PHQ-9.title: Depression Screening (PHQ-9)
PHQ-9.purpose: Measure symptoms of depression over the past two weeks.
PHQ-9.question1: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
PHQ-9.question3: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
PHQ-9.question4: Feeling tired or having little energy?
PHQ-9.question6: Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure?
PHQ-9.question7: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading or watching TV?
PHQ-9.question8: Moving or speaking so slowly that others have noticed, or the opposite?
PHQ-9.question9: Thoughts that you would be better off dead or hurting yourself?
PHQ-9.question10: How difficult have these problems made it to work or interact socially?

analysis.scoring: Sum responses for the first 9 questions (score range: 0–27). Question 10 indicates impairment.
analysis_tools: Use bar charts to show severity distribution.
analysis.insight: Identify trends (e.g., percentage of participants with moderate/severe depression).

GAD-7.title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD-7)
GAD-7.purpose: Assess anxiety levels over the past two weeks.
GAD-7.question1: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge?
GAD-7.question2: Unable to stop or control worrying?
GAD-7.question3: Worrying too much about different things?
GAD-7.question5: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still?
GAD-7.question7: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?
GAD-7.question8: How difficult have these problems made it to work or interact socially?
GAD-7.question9: Avoiding situations that make you anxious?
GAD-7.question10: Experiencing physical symptoms like sweating or trembling?

analysis.scoring: Sum the first 7 questions (score range: 0–21). Questions 8–10 offer context.
analysis_tools: Display severity distribution via pie charts.
Look for patterns in Questions 8–10 responses for contextual insights.

PSQI.title: Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
PSQI.question1: How many hours of actual sleep do you get per night?
PSQI.question3: Waking up in the middle of the night?
PSQI.question4: Waking up too early and not being able to fall asleep again?
PSQI.question5: Trouble staying awake during daytime activities?
PSQI.question6: Using medication to help you sleep?
PSQI.question8: Feeling tired or fatigued during the day?
PSQI.question9: Difficulty maintaining a consistent sleep schedule?
PSQI.question10: Rate your overall sleep quality in the past month.

analysis.scoring: Aggregate scores from all responses, rating sleep quality from poor to excellent.
analysis.visualization: Bar charts to show average sleep duration and quality.
analysis.insights: Identify if participants are at risk for sleep deprivation and correlate with daytime fatigue.

PSS.title: Perceived Stress Scale (PSS)
PSS.purpose: Understand stress levels over the past month.
PSS.question1: How often have you been upset by unexpected events?
PSS.question2: Felt unable to control important aspects of your life?
PSS.question4: Confident about your ability to handle personal problems?
PSS.question5: Felt that things were going your way?
PSS.question6: Felt difficulties were piling up too high?
PSS.question8: Felt that you were on top of things?
PSS.question9: Found that you could not cope with your workload?
PSS.question10: Felt you could handle your responsibilities?

analysis.scoring: Reverse score positive questions (e.g., 4, 5, 7, 8). Sum total scores.
analysis.visualization: Use histograms to visualize stress levels.

FFQ.title: Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ)
FFQ.question3: How often do you drink **sugary beverages**?
FFQ.question4: How often do you eat three or more meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) per day?
FFQ.question5: How often do you eat **fast food** or takeout?
FFQ.question6: How often do you consume **whole grains**? (eg. whole-wheat flour, oatmeal, and brown rice)
FFQ.question7: How often do you eat **deep-fried** food?
FFQ.question8: Do you consume **alcohol**? If so, how frequently?
FFQ.question9: How often do you consume **dairy products**? (e.g., yogurt, cheese, milk, butter)
FFQ.question10: Do you take **nutritional supplements**? If so, how frequently?

analysis.scoring: Assign values to frequency (e.g., Never = 0, Daily = 5).
analysis.insights: Highlight areas for improvement, such as reducing processed food consumption.
